name: Department of Energy
description: DOE manages the nation's nuclear infrastructure, advances energy technologies, and ensures environmental cleanup of legacy nuclear sites.

painPoints.point: Environmental cleanup and remediation cost overruns and schedule delays at legacy nuclear sites (Hanford, Savannah River, etc.)
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - DOE Environmental Cleanup

painPoints.point: Nuclear security infrastructure modernization delays and cost challenges
Grid modernization and resilience implementation challenges across multiple jurisdictions
Cybersecurity for energy infrastructure and critical systems protection
Management and Operating (M&O) contract oversight and cost control
Clean energy technology deployment and commercialization acceleration
Nuclear waste management and permanent repository development
Workforce capacity and succession planning in nuclear operations
IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting nuclear and energy IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.source: Bipartisan Infrastructure Law / Inflation Reduction Act

strategicPriorities.priority: Clean Energy Technology Development and Deployment
Nuclear Waste Management and Repository Development

prefers: Past performance with DOE or energy sector

keyOffices: Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy
insights: DOE manages massive environmental cleanup program ($7B+ annually)
Grid modernization and clean energy are major investment areas
Management and Operating (M&O) contracts are multi-billion dollar opportunities
Nuclear security and non-proliferation create specialized opportunities
Strong preference for small businesses in technology development
Cybersecurity for energy infrastructure is growing priority
